description:
Linux now powers 2% of Steam gamers, doubling its user count in three years. Arch remains the preferred game distro.

The post Linux Surges to 2% Usage on Valve’s Steam Gaming Platform appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Surges to 2% Usage on Valve’s Steam Gaming Platform

description:
Linux Mint partners with Framework Laptops, aiming for full compatibility with easy-to-upgrade, high-quality laptops for Linux users.

The post Linux Mint and Framework Laptops Join Forces appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Mint and Framework Laptops Join Forces

description:
This video demonstrates how to install VLC Media Player on Ubuntu and others. VLC (stands for "VideoLAN Client") is the world's number one open-source media player for Windows and Linux systems that is freely available for anyone to use.

The post How to Install VLC Media Player on Ubuntu and Others appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install VLC Media Player on Ubuntu and Others

description:
Fedora 41, the latest version of the Fedora operating system, was released on October 29, 2024. In this guide, we’ll walk you through the step-by-step process of installing Fedora 41 Server, ensuring a smooth setup for your server environment.

The post How to Install Fedora 41 Server with Screenshots appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Fedora 41 Server with Screenshots

description:
The Fedora Project is excited to share that Fedora Linux 41 is now officially released and comes with GNOME 47 and KDE Plasma 6.2 for desktop systems, along with the Wayland graphics stack.

The post How to Upgrade Fedora 40 to Fedora 41 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Upgrade Fedora 40 to Fedora 41

description:
In this article we discuss the benefits of Tokei - a cross-platform tool, making it easy to install on Linux, Windows, and macOS.

The post Tokei: Quickly Count Different Metrics in Your Codebase appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Tokei: Quickly Count Different Metrics in Your Codebase

description:
carbonOS's creator proposes turning GNOME OS into a daily-use distro for all, emphasizing a stock GNOME experience, Flatpak apps, and modern Linux technologies.

The post GNOME OS to Become a General-Purpose Linux Distro? appeared first on Linux Today.
title: GNOME OS to Become a General-Purpose Linux Distro?

description:
This week we got some cool news and releases, starting with Fedora Linux 41, Firefox 132, TUXEDO OS 4, and a new Raspberry Pi OS update, all bringing many exciting changes.

The post 9to5Linux Weekly Roundup: November 3rd, 2024 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 9to5Linux Weekly Roundup: November 3rd, 2024

description:
OpenPaX is an open-source kernel patch designed to enhance the security of Linux systems. Developed and hosted by Edera, OpenPaX offers an alternative to the original PaX patch, which is now distributed as part of grsecurity.

The post OpenPaX: A New Open-Source Patch for Enhanced Linux Security appeared first on Linux Today.
title: OpenPaX: A New Open-Source Patch for Enhanced Linux Security

description:
Xfce 4.20 Pre1 is now available! Download the tarballs, test for compatibility, and prepare for the final release on December 15th.

The post Xfce 4.20 Pre1: The Road to Final Release Kicks Off appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Xfce 4.20 Pre1: The Road to Final Release Kicks Off

description:
Polychromatic, a dedicated graphical front-end for managing Razer peripherals on Linux, has released its latest version, 0.9.3.

The post Polychromatic 0.9.3 OpenRazer Front-End Released appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Polychromatic 0.9.3 OpenRazer Front-End Released
